title: MAGA asks 'who is Don Lemon' after his meltdown over Trump becoming Person of the Year
content: ​"Is this a joke? Did we get something wrong? Did someone scam us? Are we sure about this, producers? There is a convicted felon on the cover of Time Magazine as the Person of the Year. Maybe we're being scammed. Did someone put out a fake tweet or something about this? I don’t know," Lemon continued his tirade against both Trump and the TIME.
summary: ​"Is this a joke? Did we get something wrong? Did someone scam us? Are we sure about this, producers? There is a convicted felon on the cover of Time Magazine as the Person of the Year. Maybe we're being scammed. Did someone put out a fake tweet or something about this? I don’t know," Lemon continued his tirade against both Trump and the TIME.

title: Did Joe Biden pardon a Chinese spy who possessed child pornography? Here's the truth
content: President Joe Biden’s recent prisoner swap with China has sparked controversy and misinformation, with some falsely claiming he “pardoned” a Chinese national convicted of child pornography. In reality, Biden commuted the sentence of Shanlin Jin, a calculated move to secure the release of three Americans wrongfully detained in China, while imposing strict conditions on Jin’s release.
summary: President Joe Biden’s recent prisoner swap with China has sparked controversy and misinformation, with some falsely claiming he “pardoned” a Chinese national convicted of child pornography. In reality, Biden commuted the sentence of Shanlin Jin, a calculated move to secure the release of three Americans wrongfully detained in China, while imposing strict conditions on Jin’s release.

title: Could CEO murder case have been solved earlier? Here are the details
content: San Francisco police identified and alerted the FBI about Luigi Mangione, the suspect in UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's murder, four days before his arrest. Mangione, reported missing weeks before the shooting, allegedly harbored resentment towards the healthcare industry, possibly due to a previous back injury.
summary: San Francisco police identified and alerted the FBI about Luigi Mangione, the suspect in UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's murder, four days before his arrest. Mangione, reported missing weeks before the shooting, allegedly harbored resentment towards the healthcare industry, possibly due to a previous back injury.

title: Francois Bayrou appointed as new French Prime Minister
content: French President Emmanuel Macron appointed François Bayrou as the new prime minister following a no-confidence vote that ousted the previous government. This is Macron's sixth prime minister and fourth this year. Bayrou, the 73-year-old MoDem leader, is tasked with forming a government and bringing stability amidst the political turmoil. He was recently acquitted in a case involving EU funds.
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron appointed François Bayrou as the new prime minister following a no-confidence vote that ousted the previous government.  This is Macron's sixth prime minister and fourth this year. Bayrou, the 73-year-old MoDem leader, is tasked with forming a government and bringing stability amidst the political turmoil. He was recently acquitted in a case involving EU funds.

title: Is the world going to end in 5079? Check Baba Vanga’s predictions for 2025 and beyond
content: Baba Vanga, the "Nostradamus of the Balkans," predicted humanity's end in 5079. She foresaw a 2025 marked by a global war originating in Europe, first contact with aliens, and the collapse of Syria triggering World War III. While skepticism surrounds her prophecies, some align with current events, urging reflection on global vulnerabilities.
summary: Baba Vanga, the "Nostradamus of the Balkans," predicted humanity's end in 5079.  She foresaw a 2025 marked by a global war originating in Europe, first contact with aliens, and the collapse of Syria triggering World War III.  While skepticism surrounds her prophecies, some align with current events, urging reflection on global vulnerabilities.

title: Who is Luigi Mangione's 'copycat' Briana Boston arrested for 'you are next' threat?
content: A Florida woman, Briana Boston, was arrested for threatening her health insurance provider, BlueCross BlueShield, echoing the phrase used by the alleged killer of a UnitedHealthcare CEO. Boston's threat, inspired by the recent killing, resulted in charges of threats to conduct a mass shooting or act of terrorism. He lawyer said she was overcharged as she only made those threats over the telephone which should come under freedom of speech.
summary: A Florida woman, Briana Boston, was arrested for threatening her health insurance provider, BlueCross BlueShield, echoing the phrase used by the alleged killer of a UnitedHealthcare CEO. Boston's threat, inspired by the recent killing, resulted in charges of threats to conduct a mass shooting or act of terrorism. He lawyer said she was overcharged as she only made those threats over the telephone which should come under freedom of speech.

title: Syria Kurds warm up to new leaders but fear for hard-won gains
content: Kurdish authorities have made overtures to Islamist-led rebels who seized power in Syria last week, but the long-oppressed community fears it could lose hard-won gains it made during the war, including limited self-rule. As rebels led by Islamist group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) seized power, ousting president Bashar al-Assad, the Kurdish authorities in northeastern Syria have multiplied overtures to the new leaders, like adopting the three-starred flag used by the opposition.
summary: Kurdish authorities have made overtures to Islamist-led rebels who seized power in Syria last week, but the long-oppressed community fears it could lose hard-won gains it made during the war, including limited self-rule. As rebels led by Islamist group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) seized power, ousting president Bashar al-Assad, the Kurdish authorities in northeastern Syria have multiplied overtures to the new leaders, like adopting the three-starred flag used by the opposition.

title: Watch: 'Fireball' meteor lights up Indiana skies, 'like it was daylight'
content: A bright fireball illuminated the Indiana sky early Tuesday, startling residents. Seen by many across the Midwest, the bolide created a sonic boom as it burned through the atmosphere. Experts confirm such events, though uncommon, occur when space debris collides with Earth. The Geminid meteor shower, peaking soon, offers further opportunities for celestial sightings.
summary: A bright fireball illuminated the Indiana sky early Tuesday, startling residents.  Seen by many across the Midwest, the bolide created a sonic boom as it burned through the atmosphere.  Experts confirm such events, though uncommon, occur when space debris collides with Earth. The Geminid meteor shower, peaking soon, offers further opportunities for celestial sightings.

title: Blinken urges Mideast nations to support a peaceful Syrian political transition
content: US secretary of state Antony Blinken seeks Middle East unity on Syria's transition after Assad's ouster, aiming to prevent further regional instability and an ISIS resurgence. He finds "broad agreement" with Turkey on an inclusive interim government. Meanwhile, the UN reports attacks on aid convoys in Gaza and condemns Israeli strikes in Syria.
summary: US secretary of state Antony Blinken seeks Middle East unity on Syria's transition after Assad's ouster, aiming to prevent further regional instability and an ISIS resurgence.  He finds "broad agreement" with Turkey on an inclusive interim government.  Meanwhile, the UN reports attacks on aid convoys in Gaza and condemns Israeli strikes in Syria.

title: Four Indian-Americans among 1,500 granted clemency by US President Biden
content: President Biden granted clemency to nearly 1,500 individuals, including four Indian-Americans convicted of fraud and drug-related offenses. The commutations, the largest single-day act of this kind in recent history, aimed to address sentencing disparities and offer second chances to those demonstrating rehabilitation.
summary: President Biden granted clemency to nearly 1,500 individuals, including four Indian-Americans convicted of fraud and drug-related offenses.  The commutations, the largest single-day act of this kind in recent history, aimed to address sentencing disparities and offer second chances to those demonstrating rehabilitation.

title: Was Kamala Harris 'drunk' during Christmas speech in DC? Social media reacts to viral video
content: A viral video of Vice President Kamala Harris at a gathering sparked social media speculation about her demeanor. Users commented on her appearance and political future, referencing a previous video that drew similar reactions. Harris's remarks about bringing dishes to events and having "no regrets" fueled the online discussion.
summary: A viral video of Vice President Kamala Harris at a gathering sparked social media speculation about her demeanor.  Users commented on her appearance and political future, referencing a previous video that drew similar reactions.  Harris's remarks about bringing dishes to events and having "no regrets" fueled the online discussion.

title: People think of health insurance denial as act of violence: Republican Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez on CEO murder
content: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez linked the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson to public frustration over denied health insurance claims. She stated that many perceive claim denials as acts of violence due to the resulting financial hardships, sometimes leading to homelessness.
summary: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez linked the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson to public frustration over denied health insurance claims. She stated that many perceive claim denials as acts of violence due to the resulting financial hardships, sometimes leading to homelessness.

title: Remake of Bill Gates incident? Enron new CEO Connor Gaydos hit with 'pie in face' - watch viral video
content: Connor Gaydos, the new CEO of the relaunched Enron, known for the "Birds Aren't Real" theory, was recently pied in the face. The incident, captured on video, has gone viral, drawing comparisons to Bill Gates' similar experience. Gaydos' company acquired the Enron name in 2020, aiming for a revolutionary comeback after the company's infamous collapse.
summary: Connor Gaydos, the new CEO of the relaunched Enron, known for the "Birds Aren't Real" theory, was recently pied in the face.  The incident, captured on video, has gone viral, drawing comparisons to Bill Gates' similar experience. Gaydos' company acquired the Enron name in 2020, aiming for a revolutionary comeback after the company's infamous collapse.

title: 'Time to zen out': Luigi Mangione went on solo Asia trip for months before allegedly killing CEO Brian Thompson
content: Luigi Mangione, suspected of killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, traveled through Asia before vanishing. He resurfaced in New York City after being reported missing and allegedly committed the murder. Investigators are probing his travels, a past back injury, and social media posts expressing anger towards insurance companies.
summary: Luigi Mangione, suspected of killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, traveled through Asia before vanishing.  He resurfaced in New York City after being reported missing and allegedly committed the murder.  Investigators are probing his travels, a past back injury, and social media posts expressing anger towards insurance companies.

title: 'Surgery was painful': UnitedHealthcare CEO killer Luigi Mangione's social media posts indicate about his health struggles
content: Luigi Mangione, suspected in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, openly documented his journey with chronic back pain and spinal surgery on social media. His posts initially reflected relief after a successful operation in 2023.
summary: Luigi Mangione, suspected in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, openly documented his journey with chronic back pain and spinal surgery on social media. His posts initially reflected relief after a successful operation in 2023.

title: 'Heart of Jupiter moon Io's rage': Nasa captures active volcano erupting into space
content: NASA's Juno mission revealed that Jupiter's moon, Io, the most volcanic body in our solar system, doesn't possess a global magma ocean. Instead, separate magma chambers fuel its over 400 active volcanoes, solving a 44-year-old mystery. Juno's gravity data, collected during recent flybys, confirms this, impacting our understanding of other moons and exoplanets.
summary: NASA's Juno mission revealed that Jupiter's moon, Io, the most volcanic body in our solar system, doesn't possess a global magma ocean.  Instead, separate magma chambers fuel its over 400 active volcanoes, solving a 44-year-old mystery.  Juno's gravity data, collected during recent flybys, confirms this, impacting our understanding of other moons and exoplanets.

title: Five minutes to martial law: South Korea's Yoon stunned cabinet with snap move
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's sudden declaration of martial law on December 3rd plunged the nation into chaos. A late-night cabinet meeting, convened with little notice, revealed Yoon's unilateral decision, sparking fierce objections from ministers concerned about economic fallout. Despite pleas, Yoon proceeded with the declaration, triggering market panic and a dramatic parliamentary response.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's sudden declaration of martial law on December 3rd plunged the nation into chaos. A late-night cabinet meeting, convened with little notice, revealed Yoon's unilateral decision, sparking fierce objections from ministers concerned about economic fallout. Despite pleas, Yoon proceeded with the declaration, triggering market panic and a dramatic parliamentary response.

title: Canadian premiers urge Trudeau to take strong action against looming US tariffs
content: Canadian premiers urged Prime Minister Trudeau to strongly counter US President-elect Trump's threatened tariffs. They proposed retaliatory measures, including halting energy exports, citing US reliance on Canadian goods. Trump's tariffs, expected soon after his inauguration, are conditional on addressing drug and immigration concerns. The US imported hundreds of billions of dollars worth of goods from Canada in recent years.
summary: Canadian premiers urged Prime Minister Trudeau to strongly counter US President-elect Trump's threatened tariffs.  They proposed retaliatory measures, including halting energy exports, citing US reliance on Canadian goods.  Trump's tariffs, expected soon after his inauguration, are conditional on addressing drug and immigration concerns.  The US imported hundreds of billions of dollars worth of goods from Canada in recent years.

title: No evidence to suggest mysterious New Jersey drones work of foreign adversary: White House
content: Mysterious drones have been buzzing over New Jersey, sparking UFO theories and concerns. The Pentagon denies any foreign involvement, specifically dismissing Rep. Jeff Van Drew's suggestion of an Iranian "mothership." However, the FBI admits uncertainty, even suggesting some sightings might be misidentified aircraft.
summary: Mysterious drones have been buzzing over New Jersey, sparking UFO theories and concerns. The Pentagon denies any foreign involvement, specifically dismissing Rep. Jeff Van Drew's suggestion of an Iranian "mothership." However, the FBI admits uncertainty, even suggesting some sightings might be misidentified aircraft.

title: Did 'life-altering injury' drive Luigi Mangione to kill UnitedHealthcare CEO? Cops share new details
content: Police arrested Luigi Mangione, 26, in Pennsylvania for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in NYC. Mangione's July back injury and subsequent surgery are suspected motives. A note criticizing the US healthcare system and a notebook detailing the murder plan were found with Mangione. He is fighting extradition to New York.
summary: Police arrested Luigi Mangione, 26, in Pennsylvania for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in NYC.  Mangione's July back injury and subsequent surgery are suspected motives.  A note criticizing the US healthcare system and a notebook detailing the murder plan were found with Mangione. He is fighting extradition to New York.
